page.title: 01SUMMARY CHISLET & HOATH
page.content:
This is a rural area including parts of the civil parishes of{Chislet}and{ {Hoath.}The undulating countryside in the west rises 30m above sea level.In the east it slopes down to the R.Stour and the Wantsum where the sea once divided Thanet from Kent.In the S.E. corner of the area is part of the Stodmarsh Nature Reserve.
There are 4 villages.{Chislet}and { {Hoath}are pre-Roman settlements looking towards the sea. { Upstreet}and{Hersden}are on the Canterbury-Thanet road.{Upstreet}lies at the junction of this road with the river crossing at{Grove ferry}. {Hersden}was built in the 1920s to house the miners of {Chislet Colliery {(closed in 1969).
